A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Unlike any previous Star Wars film\, The Last Jedi left me with an extreme range of emotions. Happiness\, confusion\, anger and sadness. It is a film worth watching\, if only for the superb performances Adam Driver and Mark Hamill deliver. I could've done without some aspects though. Their attempt at lighthearted laugh-out-loud humor clashed with the otherwise dark tone of the story\, the middle felt too long and I left with more questions unanswered than when I arrived. All in all\, not a bad film. Rian Johnson took a risk with this one\, and sometimes that's just what needs to be done. To fully process and understand the plot\, this is definitely a film that needs 2 or 3 viewings.
